intro: Phycella attenuata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved phycella, is a variant of the phycella plant characterized by its wider leaves compared to the typical form. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. The flowers are small and clustered, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
